pages.text: Mosaic tiles are ornamental blocks, made by setting pieces of colored materials on a concrete core in different patterns.
Mosaic tiles are designed and made using tessellation workbenches.

To design and make a mosaic tile, you need two different mosaic pieces and a concrete block. You could of cource use two pieces of the same kind, which only results in monochrome tiles regardless of the pattern you choose â€“ still useful sometimes.

Three types of materials, namely pumice ($(#86857b)pale$()), basalt ($(#2b2b35)dark$()), and brick ($(#874a3a)ocher$()), as well as 11 patterns are provided so far. You can combine them to yield various tiles.
